msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 186 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 76; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 19 lines per page; Dimensions: 170 x 215mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1270-71 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 31: "95 E. H. 76. Mushaf. Aharlı krem rengi kâğıt. 215mm boy ve 170mm eninde 186 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli nesihle 105mm uzunl.[uğunda] 19 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eli ile 669 (1270-71)de istinsah edilmiştir. Sultan Murad’a Ḥasan b. abī Nammī b. Barakat tarafından Mekkeden gönderilmiştir. Y. 1b ve 2a da halkâri iki sahife; Y. 2b ve 3a da hendesi geçmelerle müzehhep iki sahife, sure başları cüz, hizip, v.s. gülleri müzehhep, cetveller ve duraklar yaldızlı. Miklepli mor deri cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "95 E. H. 76. Muṣḥaf. Cream-colored sized paper. 186 leaves of 215 mm height and 170 mm width. The text area written in naskh with diacritics, [contains] 19 lines measuring 105 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 669 (1270-71). It is sent to Sultan Murad by Ḥasan ibn abī Nammī ibn Barakat from Mecca. There are two gilded (halkâri) leaves on [Leaf] L. 1b and 2a and two illuminated leaves with geometric interlaced patterns on [Leaf] L. 2b and 3a. Sūra beginnings, juzʾ, ḥizb, and sajda roses are illuminated. Verse separators and and the rule-borders are gilded. Violet leather binding with flap (miklep).”
